result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad A Degrand was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Retain Possession (>$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (>$500 - $5000)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintaint full-time employment as directed by Dept. of Corrections.
No contact with any Walmart stores.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 18 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.  Defendant must have a DNA sample of file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed. For every $250 paid toward restitution within the first year of probation, jail time will be reduced by 15 days. If stay is lifted, sentence can be served in Brown County with huber privileges.
10/25/17 - Court stays conditional jail time indefinitely. DTE

records.addlTxt: Defendant Chad A Degrand in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers and attorney Lee Schuchart.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 3.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 3. Court dismisses Cts. 1 & 2 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense are ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant makes statement to the court.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates defendant is still in the Brown County Jail facing new drug charges. Atty Gerbers hopes to resolve this matter fairly soon. State requests a status in March to see where matter is at. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates defendant is incarcerated in the Brown County Jail on new charges, requests a status in 60 days to see where those charges are at. State has no objection.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Chad A Degrand in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers feels matter will resolve short of trial, requests a status in December. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Chad A Degrand in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers requests a 60 day adjournment. State has objection with adjournment up to 60 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
State's Discovery Demand
No contact direct or indirect with any Walmart or Shopko stores.
to signature bond

Atty Gerbers asks court to reduce cash bond or amend cash bond to a signature bond, makes statement. Defendant makes statement on bond modification. State gives argument on bond modification.  Court makes statement, amends cash bond to a $2,500 signature bond. Same conditions apply.

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State will be filing the Information and State's Discovery Demand later today.  Assuming Information contains same three charge, defense would waive reading of the Information and enter not guilty plea to all counts.

Defendant Chad A Degrand in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Chad A Degrand in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing today.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
Defendant was fingerprinted 6/03/15 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 4/27/16)
No contact direct or indirect with any Walmart or Shopko stores.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Chad A Degrand appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
